'''''Mythlore'' 73''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol19/iss3/ Volume 19, Issue 3]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].

==Contents==

====Articles====

* Patterson, Nancy-Lou. “Why We Honor the Centenary of Dorothy L. Sayers (1893-1957).”
* Patterson, Nancy-Lou. “‘A Bloomsbury Blue-Stocking’: Dorothy L. Sayers' Bloomsbury Years in Their ‘Spatial and Temporal Content’.”
* Nicholson, Mervyn. “Bram Stoker and C.S. Lewis: ''Dracula'' as a Source for ''That Hideous Strength''.”
* Christopher, Joe R. “The Fragmentary Lord Peter.”
* Carlin, Russell. “The Hero Who Was Thursday: A Modern Myth.”
* Beach, Sarah. “Harriet in Rehearsal: Hilary Thorpe in ''The Nine Tailors''.”
* McComas, Alan. “Negating and Affirming Spirit Through Language: The Integration of Character, Magic, and Story in ''The Lord of the Rings'': Part II.”
* Filmer-Davies, Kath. “''Chwedl Gymaeg a Llenyddiaeth Gyfoesol:'' Welsh Myth and Contemporary Literature.”

====Features====

* GoodKnight, Glen. Editorial Introduction: In This Issue.
* Christopher, Joe R., and Wayne G. Hammond. An Inklings Bibliography (50).
* Kondratiev, Alexei. “Tales Newly Told.”
* Letters.
* Patterson, Nancy-Lou, and Sarah Beach. “Artists' Comments.”

====Reviews====

* ''Tolkien: A Critical Assessment.'' Brian Rosebury. Reviewed by Glen GoodKnight.
* ''The Road to Middle-earth.'' T.A. Shippey. Reviewed by Glen GoodKnight.
* ''J.R.R. Tolkien: A Descriptive Bibliography.'' Wayne Hammond and Douglas Anderson. Reviewed by Glen GoodKnight.
* ''George MacDonald.'' William Raeper. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
* ''The Fiction of C.S. Lewis: Mask and Mirror.'' Kath Filmer. Reviewed by Nancy-Lou Patterson.
